forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Rain showers likely before 5pm, then a slight chance of showers and thunderstorms. Partly sunny. High near 55, with temperatures falling to around 52 in the afternoon. West wind around 18 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts less than a tenth of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Slight Chance Showers And Thunderstorms then Mostly Clear
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of showers and thunderstorms before 11pm. Mostly clear. Low around 44, with temperatures rising to around 46 overnight. Northwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
The afternoon in Downtown San Francisco unfolds beneath a heavy canopy of slate-gray clouds, hinting at the remnants of rain, with showers expected until the late afternoon. The air carries a slight chill, nudged along by a brisk west wind that whips through the avenues, igniting a sense of brisk adventure amid the shifting weather patterns. As temperatures dip to the low 50s, the day presents a complicated charm—parts of the city are bathed in muted light, while others remain shrouded in the low-hanging clouds or occasional gusts of wind-driven mist.

As dusk approaches, a slight chance of showers lingers, but the sky may give way to moments of clarity—a silver lining in the encroaching evening. This time of year invites layered clothing; a smart blend of a light waterproof jacket and perhaps a cozy scarf would serve well against the cool air and fluttering breezes. For those who find delight in the urban landscape, this weather offers an opportunity to stroll along the waterfront or sip on a warm beverage at a local café, watching as the city transforms under the softly fading light, revealing a less frequent yet captivating side of San Francisco.
